item.title: Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 将在硅谷提供自动驾驶汽车服务
item.description: Alphabet 公司旗下的自动驾驶汽车公司 Waymo 表示，它将开始在加利福尼亚州山景城总部附近的少数几个城市运送乘客。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s self-driving car firm, Waymo, said it will begin transporting passengers in a handful of cities near its Mountain View, California, headquarters.】

item.title: 特朗普呼吁对加拿大征收新关税，油菜籽创三个月新低
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示将对油菜籽第一大生产国加拿大增加钢铝关税后，油菜籽期货跌幅扩大，创下自12月以来的最低水平。【原文：Canola futures extended a drop to the lowest levels since December after President Donald Trump said he’s increasing steel and aluminum tariffs on Canada, the top producer of the oilseed.】

item.title: Verizon股价下滑，公司将迎来 "充满挑战 "的一季度
item.description: 本周二，威瑞森通信公司（Verizon Communications Inc.【原文：Shares of Verizon Communications Inc. dropped the most since 2023 on Tuesday after the company gave a muted outlook for growth in mobile-phone subscribers in the current quarter.】

item.title: 萨默斯认为今年经济衰退的可能性接近一半
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）表示，由于特朗普政府采取的一系列政策措施正在削弱人们的信心，美国今年陷入衰退的可能性几乎为一半。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said there’s almost a 50-50 likelihood of the US tipping into a recession this year due to a range of policy steps from the Trump administration that are undermining confidence.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁加倍征收钢铁税，加元暴跌
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示将把对加拿大征收的钢铝关税提高至 50%，将午夜后生效的征税计划提高一倍后，加元跌至一周低点，当地债券反弹。【原文：The Canadian dollar slid to a weekly low and local bonds rallied after US President Donald Trump said he would raise steel and aluminum tariffs on Canada to 50%, doubling a planned levy set to take effect just after midnight.】

item.title: 波动率曲线反转预示短期股价痛苦
item.description: 在市场低迷的情况下，波动率的上升是非常渐进的，单日价格走势就像没有明天一样。同时，VIX 指数的未来曲线还没有显示出持久的压力。【原文：The rise in volatility has been very gradual amid a market slump that had one-day price action like there is no tomorrow. Meanwhile the VIX Index’s future curve isn’t suggesting lasting stress yet.】

item.title: 风险投资人找到了复杂的加密货币化方法
item.description: 加密货币投资者通过与专业交易公司达成复杂的协议，锁定了表面上被禁止出售的数字资产的收益。【原文：Cryptocurrency investors are locking in returns from digital assets they’re ostensibly barred from selling by entering into complex arrangements with specialist trading firms.】

item.title: 欧盟财政部长担心国防开支计划可能推高收益率
item.description: 欧盟各国财政部长担心债券投资者可能不愿为他们的国防开支计划提供资金，而德国的大规模计划已经推高了该地区的偿债成本。【原文：European Union finance ministers are worried bond investors could be reluctant to finance their defense-spending plans, with a massive German program already driving up debt-servicing costs in the region.】

item.title: 摩根大通的莱博维茨准备买入下跌行情，尽管他押注经济衰退 20
item.description: 摩根大通资产管理公司（JPMorgan Asset Management）的大卫-莱博维茨（David Lebovitz）在他的团队将美国经济衰退的可能性从 15%上调至 20%的同时，也向华尔街的客户发出了乐观的信息：准备逢低买入。【原文：Even as his team dials up the chances of a US recession to 20% from 15%, JPMorgan Asset Management’s David Lebovitz has a sanguine message for clients on Wall Street: Get ready to buy the dip.】

item.title: 特朗普称将对加拿大钢铁和铝加倍征收关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他将对加拿大商品征收的钢铝关税提高到 50%，以报复安大略省对输往美国的电力征税的举动。【原文：President Donald Trump said he was increasing the steel and aluminum tariff on Canadian goods to 50% to retaliate against Ontario’s move to place a levy on electricity sent to the US.】

item.title: 美国职位空缺和辞职人数增加，显示劳动力市场具有活力
item.description: 美国 1 月份的职位空缺有所增加，同时裁员人数下降，辞职人数回升，这表明特朗普政府上台后劳动力市场出现了恢复性增长。【原文：US job openings rose in January while layoffs fell and quits picked up, indicating resilience in the labor market as the Trump administration took office.】

item.title: Karooooo 计划在莫桑比克动荡局势中进行商誉减值
item.description: 在纳斯达克上市的 Karooooo Ltd.公司提供车辆跟踪和车队管理服务，由于东南非国家的政治动荡，该公司将对莫桑比克业务的商誉计提减值准备。【原文：Nasdaq-listed Karooooo Ltd., which provides vehicle-tracking and fleet-management services, will provide for an impairment of goodwill in its Mozambique operations due to the political upheaval gripping the southeast African nation.】

item.title: 从棒球棒到骨灰盒，特朗普的新关税将打入美国本土
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普总统的钢铝关税于周三午夜零点一分在华盛顿生效，那么这将标志着他和他的支持者认为有助于拯救美国金属制造商的第一任期征税政策的重演。【原文：If and when President Donald Trump’s tariffs on steel and aluminum take effect at a minute past midnight in Washington on Wednesday, it will mark a repeat of first-term levies that he and his supporters argue helped rescue the US’s metal makers.】

item.title: 力拓寻求为收购钒锂公司筹集多达 90 亿美元资金
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，力拓集团周二将在美国投资级债券市场融资 70 亿至 90 亿美元，用于刚刚结束的对 Arcadium Lithium Plc 的收购。【原文：Rio Tinto Plc is tapping the US investment-grade bond market Tuesday to raise between $7 billion and $9 billion for its just-closed acquisition of Arcadium Lithium Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 经济学家称贸易战将迫使加拿大央行进一步削减开支
item.description: 美国和加拿大之间的贸易战促使经济学家预测，加拿大央行今年将把政策利率下调至 2%，几乎与 19 年科维德大流行之前的利率一样低。【原文：The trade battle between the US and Canada is prompting economists to predict the Bank of Canada will lower its policy interest rate to 2% this year, almost as low as before the Covid-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 欧洲央行减息结束，贝莱德转而反对欧元债券的防御策略
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）对欧元区债券持负面看法，指出该地区正转向增加国防开支，而且进一步降息的前景有限。【原文：BlackRock Inc. has turned negative on euro-area bonds, pointing to the region’s pivot toward higher defense spending and the prospect of limited additional interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 欧盟税务局局长驳斥特朗普关于增值税是贸易壁垒的说法
item.description: 欧盟税务主管表示，欧盟使用增值税不应成为与特朗普政府之间贸易紧张局势的一部分。【原文：The European Union’s tax chief said that the bloc’s use of value-added taxes shouldn’t be part of the trade tensions with the Trump administration.】

item.title: 加纳新任财政部长称去年未实现预算目标
item.description: 加纳新政府表示，上届政府未能实现在 2024 年实现基本预算盈余的目标，反而出现了巨大的资金缺口。【原文：Ghana’s new government said the previous administration had missed its goal for a primary budget surplus in 2024 and instead recorded a hefty funding gap.】

item.title: Bybit 黑客事件引发欧盟对盗贼使用的 OKX 平台进行审查
item.description: 知情人士称，欧洲加密货币监管机构正在仔细审查黑客利用 OKX（最大的数字资产交易所之一）提供的一项服务来清洗交易平台 Bybit 上 15 亿美元抢劫所得的情况。【原文：European crypto regulators are scrutinizing the use of a service offered by OKX, one of the largest digital-asset exchanges, by hackers to launder proceeds from a $1.5 billion heist on trading platform Bybit, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 大规模平仓使美国垃圾债券风险高于欧洲
item.description: 随着 "美国优先 "交易在市场上逐渐平息，一个关键指标显示，投资者现在对评级较低的美国公司的担忧超过了对欧洲公司的担忧。【原文：As the America First trade unwinds across markets, a key indicator is showing that investors are now more worried about lower-rated US companies than European ones.】

item.title: H&F's 公司在筹资中寻求 300 亿美元的估值
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Hellman & Friedman 正寻求从投资者手中为 Hub International Ltd. 筹集至少 10 亿美元的资金，这笔交易可能使这家保险经纪公司的估值达到 300 亿美元。【原文：Hellman & Friedman is looking to raise at least $1 billion in equity from investors for Hub International Ltd., in a potential deal valuing the insurance brokerage at $30 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 2025 年西班牙经济增长将超预期

item.title: Absa 力争在三年内通过削减成本节省 2.73 亿美元
item.description: Absa Group Ltd. 正在寻求通过削减南非第三大贷款机构的成本，在未来三年内节省 50 亿兰特（2.73 亿美元）。【原文：Absa Group Ltd. is seeking to save 5 billion rand ($273 million) over the next three years by cutting costs at South Africa’s third-largest lender.】

item.title: 私人信贷对零售资金的推动加剧了新的脆弱性
item.description: 国际清算银行（Bank for International Settlements）在周二的一份报告中警告说，私人信贷急于吸引散户投资者的资金，这使得该行业更容易受到传统贷款机构流动性错配的影响。【原文：Private credit’s rush to attract money from retail investors is making the sector more vulnerable to the kind of liquidity mismatches found in traditional lenders, the Bank for International Settlements warned in a report on Tuesday.】
